meanings.definition: A person who serves as a guide or guard.
meanings.sent1: The cavass led the tourists through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The cavass escorted the VIP safely to the event.
meanings.sent3: The cavass joked with the group to keep their spirits up.
meanings.sent4: The cavass was a beacon of safety in the dark forest.
meanings.sent5: The cavass's presence made the travelers feel secure.

meanings.definition: To act as a guide or guard.
meanings.sent1: She will cavass the hikers on the mountain trail.
meanings.sent2: The security guard cavasses the building every night.
meanings.sent3: He decided to cavass the lost puppy back to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The mother cavassed her children through the crowded market.
meanings.sent5: The detective cavassed the crime scene for clues.

meanings.definition: A military officer in charge of a group of soldiers.
meanings.sent1: The cavass commanded his troops with authority.
meanings.sent2: The cavass strategized the next move for the battalion.
meanings.sent3: The cavass organized a surprise drill for the soldiers.
meanings.sent4: The cavass stood tall, leading his army into battle.
meanings.sent5: The cavass's bravery inspired the entire platoon.
